greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the number of finite sequences of positive integers {b(k)} where (product b(k))* (sum b(k)) = n. Different orderings of the same integers are counted separately.
formula: a(n)=1 if n=1 or is a prime, a(2)=2 if n is the square of a prime. - _Robert G. Wilson v_
mathematica: (* first do *) Needs["DiscreteMath`Combinatorica`"] ( then *) t = Table[1, {80}]; Do[k = 1; lmt = PartitionsP@n; p = Partitions@n; While[k < lmt, a = Plus @@ p[[k]]*Times @@ p[[k]]; If[a < 81, t[[a]] += Length@ Permutations@ p[[k]]]; k++ ], {n, 40}]; t (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 03 2006 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Oct 25 2005
